isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Mirrors - Motorized

svcproc.title: Mirrors - Motorized
svcproc.para: Refer to ACCESSORY POWER in POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUND SYSTEM for description of accessory power circuits to A3 accessory adapter (501). Refer to RIGHT MOTORIZED MIRROR, DUAL MOTORIZED MIRRORS and DUAL AXIS MOTORIZED MIRRORS circuit diagrams in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W, for the following discussion.

Right Motorized Mirror -The right motorized mirror switch (437) receives power from A3 accessory adapter (501) through 10A fuse F5-A when the key is in the on or accessory position. Momentarily positioning the switch down from the neutral position closes the circuit between switch contacts 1 - 2 and 4 - 5. This applies voltage to the motor on circuit 78F and grounds the motor through 78E. Momentarily positioning the switch up from the neutral position closes the circuit between switch contacts 2-3 and 5-6. This applies voltage to the motor on circuit 78E and grounds the motor through 78F.

Dual Motorized Mirrors -The right mirror circuits in the dual motorized mirror configuration are exactly the same as those for the single right motorized mirror. The left switch (823) receives power from A3 accessory adapter (501) through 10A fuse F5-A when the key is in the on or accessory position. Momentarily positioning the switch down from the neutral position closes the circuit between switch contacts 1-2 and 4-5. This applies voltage to the motor on circuit 78F and grounds the motor through 78E. Momentarily positioning the switch up from the neutral position closes the circuit between switch contacts 2-3 and 5-6. This applies voltage to the motor on circuit 78E and grounds the motor through 78F.

Dual Axis Motorized Mirrors - The dual axis motorized mirror switch 1137 receives power from the A3 accessory adapter (501), through 10A fuse F5-A, on circuit 78C, through connector (1137), when the key is in the on or accessory position. Twisting the mirror control switch knob selects which mirror will be controlled. Positioning the L/R switch to the Left or Right position will cause the controlled mirror to move to the Left or Right. Positioning the U/D switch to the Up or Down position will cause the controlled mirror to move Up or Down. Ground for the circuits is supplied from GND Adapter (456) on circuit 78-GA through connector (1137).
Use the DUAL AXIS MOTORIZED MIRROR circuit diagrams, in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W, to determine which circuits are energized to move the mirrors.
